newsitem.title: LATVIA: MANGALI WORKS ON PUBLIC ISSUE.
newsitem.headline: MANGALI WORKS ON PUBLIC ISSUE.

text.p: Mangali Shipyard , quoted on the bourse's secondary list, said on Tuesday that it will issue 200,000 shares and expects to sign an agreement with Trasta Bank as arranger this week.
"This is a public issue with a face value of one lat, and it will be placed through auction," Armands Laukmanis, president of the company, told Reuters.
"An agreement with Trasta should be signed this week and we are finalising details," Laukmanis said.
"We will use the funds for financing the privatisation investment of 500,000 lats required from our strategic investor as well as modernisation," Laukmanis said.
The strategic investor has already invested 207,000 lats in Mangali since the sell-off agreement was signed in November of 1995.
Mangali's share capital is 1.4 million lats and 1.2 million shares with a face value of one lat are registered.
It traded at 1.05 lats on Tuesday, down one santime from Monday.
Laukmanis said that the company will meet its 1997 after-tax profit forecast of 50,000 lats and exceed its planned turnover of 1.5 million lats.
